channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Frustration and anger - why 'huge question marks' hang over Man Utd
item.description: Ruben Amorim declares himself angry and frustrated as his Manchester United side again lose a lead - with consistency continuing to be an issue.

item.title: The World Cup draw is here - this is how it will work
item.description: Pots, quadrants, confederation constraints, group position grids ... the World Cup draw is not going to be straightforward.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Newcastle want to be 'top club in world' by 2030
item.description: Newcastle United "in the debate about being the top club in the world" according to new CEO David Hopkinson.

item.title: Man Utd halted as Magassa gets first West Ham goal
item.description: Watch Premier League highlights as Manchester United are held at home by West Ham, with Soungoutou Magassa scoring his first Hammers goal.

item.title: England World Cup subs might stay indoors - Tuchel
item.description: England manager Thomas Tuchel says he may have his substitutes stay in the dressing room during matches at the World Cup next summer because of the risks posed by high temperatures.

item.title: What's on Nancy's Celtic to-do list?
item.description: Wilfried Nancy has completed his long-waited move from Columbus Crew to Celtic, but what will be the new manager's priorities in Glasgow?

item.title: Salah could still go to Saudi - Friday's gossip
item.description: Mohamed Salah could still be heading to the Saudi Pro League, Galatasaray will offer him a huge contract, and Real Madrid will rival Manchester United for a Greek wonderkid.

item.title: Who has the most and least gruelling December fixture list?
item.description: Which team has to play three matches, in three competitions, in six days later this month? And which Premier League team has the least exhausting December schedule? BBC Sport takes a look.

item.title: Trump and Infantino - too close for comfort?
item.description: Friday’s World Cup draw in Washington DC will be the latest illustration of the ever-closer relationship between US President Donald Trump and Fifa president Gianni Infantino.

item.title: Leeds stun Chelsea to end four-game losing streak
item.description: Struggling Leeds end a four-game losing run to dent Chelsea's Premier League title charge with a stunning 3-1 win at Elland Road.

item.title: Mukiele own goal hands Liverpool draw with Sunderland
item.description: Florian Wirtz's shot takes a deflection off of Nordi Mukiele to earn Liverpool a hard-won point against Sunderland

item.title: Arsenal extend unbeaten run with victory over Brentford
item.description: Mikel Merino and Bukayo Saka score as Arsenal beat Brentford to restore their five-point lead at the top of the Premier League table.

item.title: Villa come from behind to beat Brighton in seven-goal thriller
item.description: Ollie Watkins scores twice to pull his team back from two goals behind as Aston Villa go on to defeat Brighton 4-3.

item.title: Forest claim three points as Wolves' winless run continues
item.description: Igor Jesus' first Premier League goal condemns winless Wolves to another defeat as Nottingham Forest edge a poor game at Molineux.

item.title: Munoz scores as Palace edge past Burnley for win
item.description: Daniel Munoz scores the only goal as Crystal Palace climb to fifth in the Premier League with victory against Burnley.

item.title: Can anyone stop Lampard's Coventry winning the Championship?
item.description: Frank Lampard's Coventry City are 10 points clear at the top of the Championship and could create history - but will anything stand in their way?

item.title: VAR corner checks won't cause delays - referee boss Collina
item.description: Using video assistant referee checks to rule on corners will not hold up matches, says Fifa's head of referees Pierluigi Collina.

item.title: Hislop being treated for aggressive prostate cancer
item.description: Former Premier League goalkeeper Shaka Hislop says he has an aggressive form of prostate cancer, and urges men of Caribbean heritage to get tested for the disease.

item.title: 'I feared failure' - why Savage left club that 'saved' him
item.description: Four years on from film crews witnessing Macclesfield FC's rise from the ashes, a new documentary follows Robbie Savage as he takes over as manager at the club he helped to create.

item.title: From out-shining Cole Palmer to a new start and FA Cup joy at Buxton
item.description: Tai Sodje outscored Cole Palmer as Manchester City teenagers, now at 22 he is building his senior career at non-league FA Cup hopefuls Buxton.

item.title: 'I am a leader, not a boss' - Celtic's Nancy
item.description: Wilfried Nancy has joined Celtic as "a leader" first and foremost after arriving as manager.

item.title: Dunfermline decry 'severe' four-game Lennon ban
item.description: Dunfermline are "extremely disappointed with the severity" of manager Neil Lennon's six-match touchline ban, two of which are suspended.

item.title: What do you want from Scotland's World Cup draw?
item.description: Glamour games, a generous group or perhaps a bit of both? BBC Scotland examines the possibilities for Steve Clarke's side in Friday's World Cup draw.

item.title: Woeful Wolves on course for lowest Christmas points tally
item.description: Wolves' winless start to the season means they are on course for some unwanted records - including equalling the Premier League's lowest Christmas points tally.

item.title: Real Madrid's Alexander-Arnold out for two months
item.description: England defender Trent Alexander‑Arnold will be out for about two months after sustaining a thigh injury during Real Madrid's win over Athletic Club.

item.title: 'We're not machines' - Courtois on abuse of Vinicius Jr and Araujo
item.description: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois urges supporters to show players more "respect" after team-mate Vinicius Jr is once again the target of abuse by fans.

item.title: ACL-hit footballer's plea for more support
item.description: Lucy Connolly-Brame, 20, is raising money for private surgery after suffering a serious injury.

item.title: Bergamo to host NI's World Cup play-off with Italy
item.description: Northern Ireland's World Cup play-off semi-final against Italy will take place at Stadio di Bergamo on 26 March.

item.title: 'We lost control' - Amorim rues late West Ham leveller
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim bemoans his side's inability to hold on to a lead, after drawing 1-1 with West Ham United.

item.title: Old Trafford draw 'another step' forward for West Ham - Nuno
item.description: West Ham manager Nuno Espirito Santo is pleased with his team's work, after the Hammers came from a goal down to draw 1-1 away to Manchester United.

item.title: Arsenal squad depth is 'remarkable' - analysis
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy is impressed with the strength and depth of the Arsenal squad as the changes they made, particularly down the right side, paid off against Brentford.

item.title: How Farke stumbled on new system to get Leeds playing again
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Shay Given look at Leeds boss Daniel Farke "stumbled" on a new system and how it worked in their favour in their 3-1 win over Chelsea.

item.title: Which team won the fewest points in a Premier League season?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at which clubs amassed the lowest points tally in a single season.

item.title: Iran to attend World Cup draw after boycott threat
item.description: A delegation from Iran will attend the 2026 World Cup draw in the US on Friday after threatening to boycott it over a visa row.

item.title: Swansea wait on 'legal process' for Matos staff
item.description: Head coach Vitor Matos says he does not know whether his backroom team from former club Maritimo will be granted permission to join him at Swansea City.

item.title: Did we get too excited, too soon about Hearts?
item.description: Hearts' eight-point lead at the top of the Scottish Premiership has evaporated. So what has happened?

item.title: When will England and Scotland find out where they will play World Cup matches?
item.description: England and Scotland will know their World Cup opponents on Friday, but there will be a wait to discover where they will play.

item.title: 'Have I just outed Chelsea?' - Confession Cam
item.description: In this Chelsea edition of Confession Cam, players including Hannah Hampton, Aggie Beever-Jones, Keira Walsh and Erin Cuthbert reveal their most embarrassing moments, football icks and what football rule they would like to change.

item.title: How Watkins got back in the goals against Brighton
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given praises Ollie Watkins' work ethic for Aston Villa as the striker scores twice in their 4-3 win over Brighton.

item.title: Watch trailer for Robbie Savage: Managing Macclesfield FC
item.description: Watch the trailer for new BBC documentary Robbie Savage: Managing Macclesfield FC.

item.title: Arteta praises 'mature' Arsenal performance in win over Brentford
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says his side's performance in their 2-0 win over Brentford in the Premier League was "mature".

item.title: Slot sees 'positives' after Liverpool battle back for draw against Sunderland
item.description: Arne Slot sees positives in Liverpools performance against a "very aggressive" Sunderland press, despite drawing 1-1.

item.title: Success in 2025 - are the Lionesses ready for 2026?
item.description: England capped off a successful 2025 with resounding victories over China and Ghana at home - so what shape are they in for World Cup qualification?

item.title: Buying time or enough to save his job? Farke hails 'great' Leeds win
item.description: In the relegation zone and under increasing pressure, Leeds' win over Chelsea was a "huge result" for Daniel Farke.

item.title: Foxes in League One? Out of your mind, says James
item.description: Midfielder Jordan James says the thought of Leicester City suffering back-to-back relegations to plummet into League One defies logic.

item.title: Scottish 2026-27 season to start on 1 August
item.description: The 2026-27 SPFL season will start on the weekend of 1 and 2 August 2026 and concluded in late May.

item.title: Ferdinand to conduct World Cup draw with sporting greats
item.description: Rio Ferdinand will conduct Friday's World Cup draw in Washington DC alongside a host of sporting greats, including Tom Brady, Wayne Gretzky, Aaron Judge and Shaquille O'Neal.

item.title: Milestone for women's and girls' football in Wales
item.description: More than 20,000 girls and women are now registered to play football in Wales, marking a major milestone for the Football Association of Wales.

item.title: Leeds better than Chelsea in every aspect - Maresca
item.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca admits Leeds were better than his team in "every aspect", after the Blues lost 3-1 at Elland Road.

item.title: Leeds win over Chelsea 'well deserved' - Farke
item.description: Leeds manager Daniel Farke says his players deserved their win against Chelsea, after beating the Blues 3-1 at Elland Road to climb out of the Premier League relegation zone.

item.title: Villa commitment to gameplan fantastic - Emery
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery praises his side's "fantastic commitment to the gameplan" ad how "Villa stayed resilent after conceding two goals" in a 4-2 win at Brighton.

item.title: 'A good point' - Le Bris happy with Anfield draw
item.description: Sunderland manager Regis Le Bris says his side performed well despite the increasing pressure from Liverpool and the Anfield crowd during a 1-1 draw.

item.title: Glasner proud of clean sheet and win at Burnley
item.description: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner praises side for their "togetherness" as they beat struggling Burnley 1-0 at Turf Moor.

item.title: Racism, rape and death threats: One weekend of social media abuse in football
item.description: More than 2,000 extremely abusive social media posts were sent about managers and players in the Premier League and Women's Super League in a single weekend, a BBC investigation finds.

item.title: Which Premier League players are going to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at every Premier League player who has been confirmed to feature at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco.

item.title: Chaos at the Cottage - can Man City fix defensive issues?
item.description: Manchester City just about hold on as Fulham fight back from 5-1 down to 5-4 - no wonder Pep Guardiola is concerned by his team's leaky defence.

item.title: 'Arsenal deserve to be clear - but who's best placed to challenge?'
item.description: MOTD pundit Alan Shearer explains where Chelsea and the rest of the chasing pack need to improve if they are going to challenge Premier League leaders Arsenal.

item.title: Speaking backwards and a manager at 13 - the Solskjaer story
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer discusses Manchester United, the career he'd have chosen if he wasn't in football, and the team he'd like to manage.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What is the dubious goals committee?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the dubious goals committee is and how the identities of goal scorers are decided

item.title: Why is Son Heung-min returning to Tottenham?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why former captain Son Heung-min is returning to Tottenham.

item.title: When are Premier League players heading to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains when players will meet up with their countries at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: What leagues have a winter break and when are they?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which leagues will have a winter break in football.

item.title: Who is one card away from suspension in the Premier League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who is currently nearing a suspension in the Premier League.

item.title: Hearts 'comfortable' with finances as Budge exits
item.description: Hearts decided to "invest heavily" in their squad this summer to reap early rewards from Tony Bloom's investment and have no fears about long-term finances as Ann Budge stands down as club chair, says chief executive Andrew McKinlay.

item.title: Rangers' Fernandez in new handball controversy... what happened this time?
item.description: BBC Scotland examines two key incidents in the Scottish Premiership draw at Tannadice.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Ajax criticise 'outrageous' fireworks after match abandoned
item.description: Ajax criticise the "utterly outrageous" firework display which resulted in their Dutch league match against Groningen being abandoned.

item.title: What's going on with fan disorder at European games?
item.description: Was the disorder of Young Boys fans at Aston Villa an isolated incident, or does it indicate something more prevalent?

item.title: Scotland midfielder Gilmour to have surgery
item.description: Scotland and Napoli midfielder Billy Gilmour is facing an extended absence after the Italian club confirm he will have surgery on Monday.

item.title: Germany to host Euro 2029 as England chase trophy hat-trick
item.description: Germany will host the 2029 Women's European Championship, Uefa announces.

item.title: 'As if she won the Champions League' - Kendall's special night
item.description: Lucia Kendall's night could not have felt more special and England boss Sarina Wiegman said her goal celebration was "like winning the Champions League".

item.title: What have we learned from Scotland in 2025?
item.description: As Scotland sign off 2025 with their second win of the year, BBC Scotland ponders what we have learned about the side in the last 12 months.

item.title: I won the Euros on my period - England's Mead
item.description: BBC Bitesize's new three-part series 'Girls in PE: Breaking Down the Barriers' takes a look at why so many teenage girls continue to drop out of PE at school.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
